Charis

Charis are an offshoot of the Charon in the Creation Marlien, founded by Hera, an ex-Charon Immortal. Unlike the Charon, who may generally be considered True Neutral or Lawful Neutral, the Charis are generally Neutral Good. Though their interference in mortal affairs is infrequent, they are generally more direct, and always less secretive than the Charon.

The Charis reside in The Celestial Plane and have a strong affinity with Positive Energy.

Origin

The Charis were founded by Hera when she laid claim to the Ubrik Pearl, an artifact left behind by the Dead Gods themselves, perhaps for this precise purposed. The pearl relieves its bearer - even a Charon - of any bonds of form imposed upon themselves and its creations by the Dead Gods, and so Hera was able to easily distinguish both herself and her subordinates from their peers.

Appearance

Hera and her servants exalt an aesthetic of intricacy and extravagance in all but their names, eschewing the complex naming conventions of the Charon along with the grim appearance imposed upon them by the Dead Gods.

Their forms are much-varied and glamorous, drawing influence from all manner of creatures and art forms, mundane and magical. They favour shining gold, silver, and bronze accented by bright blues, reds, greens, and yellows in intricate patterns. Where they take on animal aspects they draw from those which are similarly heavily patterned or feature bright flares of plumage or furs. Where there is a large metalic surface, it tends to be curved and burnished to perfection.

Immortals

There is only one Charis Immortal - that being the founder, Hera.

Mortals

Dea

The Dea are pseudo-immortals sustained by Hera's will, serving directly beneath her, and more active than Hera herself. Their forms and personalities are all distinct, though they are all allied in their general benevolence. The freedom with which they wield Hera's power has lead them, historically, to be viewed as deities by many cultures and individuals, though by the year_zero they are little known and largely inactive.

  • Antheraea
  • Kepari
  • Brisbon

Eidolons

The celestial Eidolons conjured by the Charis are aspects of the Celestial Titan which slumbers in The Celestial Plane. They are often employed as messengers or bodyguards by the Charis, or used to bolster their small numbers as warriors or war-beasts in times of need.
